intro: Alsodeia pachycarpa, commonly known as the thick-fruited alsodeia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its upright, branched stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink to purple in color. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous small seeds. Alsodeia pachycarpa is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun.
